entries.title: Chōjū-jinbutsu-giga (scrolls of frolicking animals)
entries.note: Frequently cited as a proto-manga milestone: sequential ink drawings with character motion and visual storytelling.

entries.title: Hokusai Manga (北斎漫画), Volume I published
entries.note: Early use of the term “manga” for informal drawings/sketch collections; influential for later usage.

entries.title: Rakuten Kitazawa — “Tagosaku to Mokube no Tokyo Kenbutsu”
entries.note: Often referenced as an early “modern manga”/comic strip format milestone in Japan.

entries.title: Katsudō Shashin (Matsumoto fragment)
entries.note: A short animated filmstrip widely cited as the oldest known Japanese animation fragment (dating debated).

entries.title: Namakura Gatana (The Dull Sword)
entries.note: Among the oldest surviving Japanese animated shorts; early example of comedic animation.

entries.title: Momotaro: Sacred Sailors
entries.note: Widely cited as the first Japanese feature-length animated film (wartime propaganda context).

entries.title: The White Snake Enchantress (Hakujaden)
entries.note: Often cited as the first Japanese color animated feature film; Toei Animation’s first theatrical feature.

entries.title: Astro Boy TV series premieres
entries.note: Commonly cited as the first Japanese TV animation series produced as an ongoing series (Tezuka).
